p: In Malaysia, Centella asiatica ( C. asiatica) is commonly known as “ pegaga” [ 144]. C. asiatica has been traditionally used, especially in India and China, for medicinal purposes including for wound healing, stimulation of neurons, and to treat skin diseases [ 145]. Numerous pharmacological activities of the plant have been reviewed, including wound healing, antitumor, memory enhancing, antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and protective effects on the liver, heart, and brain [ 146].
